actions.committee: House Committee on Energy and Commerce
actions.text: Referred to the House Committee on Energy and Commerce.

actions.in_committee: House Committee on Energy and Commerce
actions.text: Referred to the Subcommittee on Commerce, Trade and Consumer Protection.

committees.subcommittee: Subcommittee on Commerce, Trade and Consumer Protection

official_title: To amend the Telemarketing and Consumer Fraud and Abuse Prevention Act to direct the Federal Trade Commission to prescribe rules that prohibit certain deceptive and abusive recovery practices in connection with telemarketing.
short_title: Deceptive and Abusive Recovery Practices in Telemarketing Prevention Act

summary.text: Deceptive and Abusive Recovery Practices in Telemarketing Prevention Act - Amends the Telemarketing and Consumer Fraud and Abuse Prevention Act to direct the Federal Trade Commission, with respect to certain deceptive and abusive recovery practices, to prescribe rules prohibiting requesting or receiving fee or consideration payments for obtaining goods or services, or recovering money or other items of value paid for them by a person in a previous telemarketing transaction, until seven business days after the goods, services, money, or other items of values are delivered to that person.

titles.title: Deceptive and Abusive Recovery Practices in Telemarketing Prevention Act

To amend the Telemarketing and Consumer Fraud and Abuse Prevention Act to direct the Federal Trade Commission to prescribe rules that prohibit certain deceptive and abusive recovery practices in connection with telemarketing.
